subskills.DESCRIPTION: Sort and categorize different types of weather-appropriate clothing and accessories (e.g., raincoat, sunhat, mittens)
Create simple weather symbols to represent current conditions (sunny, rainy, cloudy, windy)
Match weather conditions to appropriate outdoor activities (e.g., flying kites on windy days, swimming on sunny days)
Use basic weather tools (rain gauge, wind sock, thermometer) to collect daily weather data
Compare local weather conditions with another location using simple charts
Identify cloud types and their relationship to weather conditions
Create a simple weather forecast for the next day based on current conditions
Demonstrate how water changes states in different weather conditions (ice, liquid, vapor)
Construct a simple shelter to protect against different weather conditions
Record and graph daily temperature changes over a week using picture graphs
Design and conduct simple experiments to show how weather affects plant growth
Create a seasonal calendar showing typical weather patterns and activities for each month
